messages.message:
Hi team, has anyone run into this before when running `make update-requirements`?
```make update-requirements
pip-compile requirements.in (http://requirements.in) --output-file=requirements.txt \
	  || echo 'Please use Python 3 environment to update requirements!'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/xicheng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/bin/pip-compile", line 5, in <module>
    from piptools.scripts.compile import cli
  File "/Users/xicheng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/scripts/compile.py", line 20, in <module>
    from ..repositories import LocalRequirementsRepository, PyPIRepository
  File "/Users/xicheng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/repositories/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from .local import LocalRequirementsRepository
  File "/Users/xicheng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/repositories/local.py", line 14, in <module>
    from .pypi import PyPIRepository
  File "/Users/xicheng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 22, in <module>
    from pip._internal.cli.progress_bars import BAR_TYPES
ImportError: cannot import name 'BAR_TYPES' from 'pip._internal.cli.progress_bars' (/Users/xicheng/.pyenv/versions/3.7.3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pip/_internal/cli/progress_bars.py)
Please use Python 3 environment to update requirements!```
oo I ran into that error a lotâ€” my workaround for now was switching to pip==22.0.4 to run `make update-requirements` and then switching back to our version of pip after
but also curious if there's a better solution
Oh thanks! Can I ask what's the easiest way to switch to pip=22.0.4?
Oh yeah, just figured. Thank you so much!
